reasoning: Infantile-onset form of Krabbe disease (globoid cell leukodystrophy), a rare lysosomal storage disorder. Incidence approximately 1-2 per 1,000,000 births globally (0.1-0.2 per 100k person-years). High geographic variation with increased prevalence in certain populations (Scandinavian, Mediterranean). Well-defined genetic disease with autosomal recessive inheritance.
source: Wenger DA et al. (2001). Krabbe disease: genetic aspects and progress toward therapy. Mol Genet Metab. 74(3):213-224
